intro: Sobralia ecuadorana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian sobralia, is a striking epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It features showy, violet-blue flowers with a distinctive yellow throat and a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant has linear,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. It blooms during the dry season, typically from October to December. Sobralia ecuadorana is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in humid, shaded environments.
